channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Sorry, Baby Achieves Satire and Self-Awareness
item.description: Personal filmmaking recalls Todd Solondz and redeems the A24 formula.

item.title: Crying Jimmy Kimmel’s Eyes Are Dry For Victims Of Violent Illegal Aliens
item.description: The clown crier has shed a lot of tears for radical activists fighting against federal law enforcement in peddling the left's narrative.

item.title: Gold is going up because Trump is talking down the dollar, feeding ‘the narrative of relative U.S. decline,’ UBS fears
item.description: The dollar hasn’t been this weak for years.

item.title: Celebrating the Historically Low Murder Rate
item.description: Not only did 2025 see the largest single-year reduction in homicide on record, but the level may now be as low as it has been since 1900.

item.title: On Immigration, Let’s Just Follow the Constitution
item.description: Both sides’ tactics and threats on immigration are hurting America’s constitutional balance.

item.title: As vet bills jump 40% in recent years, startup Snout raises $110 million for its ‘membership’ model to defray costs
item.description: Costs vary based on plan, but on average customers are paying $65 a month for Snout to help take care of vet costs upfront.

item.title: SAP boss Christian Klein has seen the AI future. What you say will be more important than what you type
item.description: Christian Klein, CEO of SAP predicts the end of the keyboard as we enter the era of Applied AI and voice commands.
